channel.title: Safe zone---- problems with adding----w/ pics
channel.description:
i followed this tut http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,435378.msg3197170.html#msg3197170
Base is cammy pvp and i will even show you pictures of how i added the stuff in (in blue means i added it)
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/34e9fs1.png[/img] [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/vpuqg0.png[/img] [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/5z4h0w.png[/img] [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/28hnzf6.png[/img]
So i added in the codes find but no idea why it is not safe.

item.title: Safe zone---- problems with adding----w/ pics
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

You donâ€™t need 2 sets of coordinates within, one set should cover what you need to be completed. Try

public boolean nonWildPvP() { if((absX >= 3205 && absX <= 3212 && absY >= 3226 && absY <= 3218) || (absX >= 3269 && absX <= 3272 && absY >= 3161 && absY <=3173)) return true; } else { return false; } } }

Read full topic
item.source: Safe zone---- problems with adding----w/ pics

damn got 100 errors Mr. Despair

item.source: Safe zone---- problems with adding----w/ pics

item.title: Safe zone---- problems with adding----w/ pics
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

Alright, Iâ€™m going to just make sure you did these steps, follow them and do what they say even if you did.

Youâ€™ll want to open client.java and crtl+f

public boolean nonWild

Itâ€™s either to make the safe zone in a shape of a square or rectangle.
So say if you want to make all of Falador safe-zoned, picture a large square
or rectangle around falador, then go to the south-west corner, and write down the X and Y coords of the corner.(the south-west coords)
Next go to the north-east corner of the wanted safe-zone area, write the X and Y coords of this corner down also (the north-east coords)

now that you have got the needed coords, go back to client.java, and add another line of this. â€˜|| (absX >= #### && absX <= **** && absY >= #### && absY <= ****)â€™

The â€˜####â€™ represent the south-west coords, and the â€˜****â€™
represent the north-east coords.

so where the #### are, type in the X coord and the Ycoord of your south-west corner.
and where the **** are, type in the X coord and the Y coord of your north-east corner.

Read full topic
